body:
Try to move and run DFL folder on your C:/ (main hard drive)

Le jeu. 8 août 2019 à 10:46, Kaio-Dev <notifications@github.com> a écrit :

> Left the model training with the "train SAE.bat" and then went out for a
> few hour.
> But when i came back the preview had stopped responding. Furthermore it
> forced closed.
> Tried to re train but was greeted with
> [image: image]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62688016-48c83e00-ba0b-11e9-9194-7c7f030379c2.png>
> Decided to convert the model and then convert it to mp4 but the footage
> was the same as the original.
>
> Further information
>
> File in use:
> 7) convert SAE.bat :
>
> @echo off
> call _internal\setenv.bat
>
> "%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE%" "%DFL_ROOT%\main.py" convert ^
>     --input-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst" ^
>     --output-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\merged" ^
>     --aligned-dir "%WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned" ^
>     --model-dir "%WORKSPACE%\model" ^
>     --model SAE
>
> pause
>
> OS: Windows 10 Pro
> Python version: 3.6.4
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/issues/334?email_source=notifications&email_token=AK6TE4LAJ3L2GEFV7LMA4JDQDPMPLA5CNFSM4IKH3LPKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFUVEXG43VMWVGG33NNVSW45C7NFSM4HECYWJQ>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AK6TE4OCG6GTYGCYAFQY6WLQDPMPLANCNFSM4IKH3LPA>
> .
>

Hey, I moved it over and ran it from the new location. The problem still persists. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62698665-027dd980-ba21-11e9-9b36-93806af7b701.png)

Rename your deepfacelab folder in DFL.
put the folder on c: (root).

Le jeu. 8 août 2019 à 13:12, Kaio-Dev <notifications@github.com> a écrit :

> Hey, I moved it over and ran it from the new location. The problem still
> persists.
> [image: image]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62698665-027dd980-ba21-11e9-9b36-93806af7b701.png>
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/issues/334?email_source=notifications&email_token=AK6TE4ICP4XHTWDADKH45ETQDP5P7A5CNFSM4IKH3LPKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD33I6OQ#issuecomment-519475002>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AK6TE4OLG3CS4CKF2EFNMV3QDP5P7ANCNFSM4IKH3LPA>
> .
>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62766306-7f6a8b00-bad5-11e9-87c4-9ae763e77fdb.png)
Not too many surprises there.
And running Main.py doesn't do anything.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62766475-e8ea9980-bad5-11e9-9d29-73a0e7124419.png)
Where DeepFaceLab_TEMP is the folder consisting of the DFL folder, and DeepFaceLabCUDA9.2SSE has the bat files and the workspace.

(First, move those files back if you haven't. Your folder should have `_internal`, `workspace`, and the `.bat` files in it. If you don't know how to revert what you changed then just unpack a new set of the tools and copy over your workspace.)

I think your model collapsed while you were gone, do you have the last preview image? Is it good? Try to enable the gradient clipping option, maybe it will recover.

If that doesn't fix it: 

1. Back up your saved model
2. Make a new model with the **exact** same parameters
3. Train it to at least 2 iterations then save
4. Copy all the .h5 files from your backup into the new model's folder, overwriting the new model's data.
5. Relaunch training. 

The idea here is to reset your .dat file which holds things like training history and meta-parameters but not the actual trained model.

I don't have a preview window still available, but from when the model collapsed the preview looked okay. Gradient clipping didn't recover it.
~~Are the parameters of the config for the model training saved anywhere? As I don't remember them.~~ Found the model summary text file. 
I followed the steps you posted. 
Creating a new training proved no issues, copying over the .h5 file presented that the issues persists and the iterations value has dropped to where it would be on a new training so i believe the data file has been reset but the issue does not exist in the dat file.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28940326/62829843-0ccced00-bc46-11e9-8e66-6206a7afd099.png)
As the iteration using the previous data was up to 47,xxx. 
Thanks,

Yeah, it looks like your model collapsed. RIP.

You can try to copy over individual .h5 files with the same steps and try to save as much data as possible, but I don't think it's worth your time. For the next run:
- If you have the HDD space, use model backups. If you had backups you could just revert to a previous save and keep training.
- Turn on clipping from the start, it's worth the tiny slowdown.
- Increase your batch size, the default when you select 0 is hard coded to 4 right now. Increase it until you get OOM errors at launch, then reduce it by 2 (you can try reducing by 1 but it might OOM later).
- Unless you only have 4GB of system RAM, use optimizer mode 2. It lets you use some system ram as vram so you can increase your batch size more. If you have 16 or 32GB you can try 3 but it's slow. YMMV. 
- Use CA weights. It makes your setup slow but you gain the time back during training, plus other benefits. It's good stuff.
- Triple check your faces. We still don't know why it failed. invalid faces is a common culprit.

By the way, if you're making a new model now's the time to tune the dimensions to fit your GPU.

1. Make a new SAE model, batch size 1, choose LIAE or DF, and the rest defaults
2. Train it to iteration 2, save, reload, and increase the batch size.
3. Repeat until you get OOM errors at launch. **As an example, say you get to 8** and it OOMs.
4. Delete your model and make a new one
5. During setup use 8 as your batch size (or whatever you got) and reduce the first 2 dimension prompts, reducing both by the same proportion (-5%, -15%, etc.) **Leave the 3rd prompt as default, it is auto-scaled based on the 2nd one but doesn't tell you. 3rd should be half of the 2nd, if not larger!**
6. Repeat, reducing the dimensions until you no longer get OOM errors with batch size 8 (or whatever you got)
7. Write down your final dimensions.
8. Make a new model using those dimensions, but now you can enable CA weights and other parameters.

(This is all LIAE, I don't remember if DF has 3 or 4 dimensions but the same idea applies)

issue.title: What is good and efficient ??

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
I am using gtx1080ti and 32gb ram

Which is best to use h64, df or sae?

Please let me know that the quality comes out most efficiently

body:
Hey, the issue still persists 
I clipped it happening this time.
https://youtu.be/Ctu7MV9OUUg
I'm not sure why the model is crashing as it is.

For some reason since the last major Windows 10 update this seems to happen to me more and more - GTX 1080 Ti card and plenty of CPU and RAM.  Used to be able to run a batch size of 12 with higher dimensions than standard, but now I cannot run even the defaults.  Mainly getting "CUDA Unspecified Launch Failure" errors, sometimes others.

I've triad Auroir's steps above and it looks like it helps, particularly when I switched to liae.  Typically, the error is this:
2019-10-13 10:49:54.263699: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_event.cc:48] Error polling for event status: failed to query event: CUDA_ERROR_LAUNCH_FAILED: unspecified launch failure
2019-10-13 10:49:54.267340: F tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_event_mgr.cc:274] Unexpected Event status: 1

But, it's still not perfect, I'll still get CUDA crashes even with a batch of 4, and especially when I am using the PC.  Used to never happen.  Are there other issues maybe related to the drivers or configuration of the graphics card itself that might be contributing?

issue.title: Deepfacelab preview window randomly freezes and causes PC to crash / blue screen.

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
THIS IS NOT TECH SUPPORT FOR NEWBIE FAKERS
POST ONLY ISSUES RELATED TO BUGS OR CODE

## Expected behavior

I launch the training (SAE or Quick96) with minimal parameters and i expect the training to run smoothly. Especially that i turned off EVERYTHING while training to maximize the VRAM available.

## Actual behavior

Well, no error is shown. After a random number of iterations (sometimes after 30 sec, sometimes after 3 minutes of training), the preview window just freezes. If i put my mouse over it, it shows the windows 10 loading cursor. And the console, even though it is responding, the iterations don't move. Nothing changes. And i can't quit the training nor close or force close anything. The only choice i have is to either force restart the PC from the tower button, or to wait until it blue screens it.

## Steps to reproduce

I used the facesets that come with deepfacelab. I tried the models with default options (except the batch size that i reduced in every try, from 8 to 2, and the face type i put wf). I just launch the training process, and everything goes smoothly. Sometimes it saves and backs up. But it randomly freezes and stops responding. No crash messages, no error messages. Just a hard reboot.

## Other relevant information

- I tried all versions of deepfacelab. Even the "old" deepfacelab (since it used to work on my PC) yet none of them had a different result.

- I have a RTX2080 Ti and i already successfully ran deep learning algorithms on it without any problems, the last one being 2 weeks ago.

- I have 1 TB of free space. And i have enough VRAM to run it. Even with low batch sizes, i wasn't above 50% of my VRAM (11 GB) yet it still crashed and froze my PC. I tried setting a limit in main.py and i cleaned my PC and aired it out. Really nothing seems to work.

- I have researched this problem for a week now. Noone seems to have the same issue. I found a similar issue which is the issue #334 but he had it during the convert stage and he had an error message. And i tried all the solutions that were suggested in his issue, and none of them worked.
I even turned off quick edit and  insert mode of my command prompt (since i saw that it sometimes causes python to freeze). I will say that it no longer crashes when i use Quick96 but still freezes on SAEHD.

Thank you in advance for any help, and i hope i put all the details that are necessary.
